title: Verify: "Generic Catchall" message for blacked out content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has launched the app
AND successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to access a VOD
AND the content is blacked out
AND the user is in a blacked out location
AND the blacked out content's HEADLINE and/or SHOW_NAME are unknown

Test ALL entry points:
- Network Home Screen
- Show page
- Schedule
- Search > "Most Popular"
- Watchlist
- (TBD-needs confirmation) Continue Watching (this should not be possible to get a blacked out content in the CW list, but if someone moved to a blackout country after creating a CW list it could happen)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive the message below
AND the asset will NOT play
AND the user will remain on the page they started on.

*Content Unavailable*
*This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout.*

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide 
AND the user will be returned to the page from where the video launch was attempted from.

title: Scenario: User is already in live stream when blacked-out content starts to air
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
And has launched the linear stream when the content had no blackout restrictions
custom_steps:
When the program transitions to either a blacked out episode in a series
OR a blacked out live PPV event
OR a blacked out piece of content where the TITLE and the SHOW_NAME are unknown
AND the user is in a blacked out location
(Verify all scenarios)
custom_expected:
Then the video playback will stop; video/audio will not be observed/heard
AND the user will receive one of the following messages:
Episodes in a Series:
"Content Unavailable
This episode of SHOW_NAME  is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

PPV Live Events: 
"Content Unavailable
TITLE is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."
     
Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."
     
AND an OK button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the OK button is selected
THEN the message will hide and the user will be returned to where the video was launched from (WWE 'Home' view or 'Schedule > Today' depending on where the content was accessed from).


*NOTE: Some developers are noting that the expected in this case is to always show the Generic Message, confirmation has not been received.*

title: Scenario: User tries to access live stream from app Home Screen while blacked-out content is airing
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to access the linear stream from the app Home Screen
AND the content is blacked out
AND the blacked out content is an episode in a series
OR a blacked out live PPV event (either "On Now" or Ghost/Spanish Event)
OR a blacked out piece of content where the TITLE and the SHOW_NAME are unknown
AND the user is in a blacked out location
(Verify all scenarios)
custom_expected:
Then the user will be prevented from viewing the blacked out content 
AND will receive one of the following messages:

Episodes in a Series:
"Content Unavailable
This episode of SERIES_NAME is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

PPV Live Events:
"Content Unavailable
SHOW_NAME is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide 
AND the WWE Home screen will be displayed.

title: Scenario: User tries to access live stream from Schedule > Today page while blacked-out content is airing
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to access the linear stream from the Schedule > Today page
AND the content is blacked out
AND the blacked out content is an episode in a series
OR a blacked out live PPV event (either "On Now" or Ghost/Spanish Event)
OR a blacked out piece of content where the TITLE and the SHOW_NAME are unknown
AND the user is in a blacked out location
(Verify all scenarios)
custom_expected:
Then the user will be prevented from viewing the blacked out content 
AND will receive one of the following messages:

Episodes in a Series:
"Content Unavailable
This episode of SHOW_NAME is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

PPV Live Events:
"Content Unavailable
TITLE is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide 
AND the Schedule > Today screen will be displayed.

title: Scenario: User can access live stream again from Schedule > Today page after blacked-out content is off the air
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to access the linear stream from the Schedule > Today page
AND the current content is not blacked out for the user's location
AND the previous content was blacked out
custom_expected:
Then the user should be able to access the stream without issue regardless of location
(Check the following locations: UK, India, US)

title: Scenario: User can access live stream again from app Home Screen after blacked-out content is off the air
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to access the linear stream from the app Home Screen
AND the current content is not blacked out for the user's location
AND the previous content was blacked out
custom_expected:
Then the user should be able to access the stream without issue regardless of location
(Check the following locations: UK, India, US)

title: Scenario: User is already in live stream and attempts to scrub back into blacked out content
custom_preconds:
NOTE: HTML5 Does Not Support Seek in Linear Playback 

Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
And has launched the linear stream when the content had no blackout restrictions
custom_steps:
When the user attempts to scrub back into a blacked out episode in a series
OR a blacked out PPV event
OR a blacked out piece of content where the SHOW_NAME or the TITLE are unknown
AND the user is in a blacked out location
(Verify all scenarios)
custom_expected:
Then the user will receive one of the following messages:
Episodes in a Series:
"Content Unavailable
This episode of SHOW_NAME is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

PPV Live Events:
"Content Unavailable
TITLE is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide and the user will be returned to where the video was launched from (WWE 'Home' view or 'Schedule > Today' depending on where the content was accessed from).

title: Scenario: User is in Live stream, but is not at Live point (has scanned back before the 'Live' point) when blacked-out content starts to air
custom_preconds:
NOTE: HTML5 Does Not Support Seek in Linear Playback 

Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
And has launched the linear stream when the content had no blackout restrictions
And seeks back to the beginning of the sliding DVR window (1 hour back)
custom_steps:
When the user watches the video for a while
And Meanwhile, a new program starts that is blacked-out
And then the user scrubs to the live position
custom_expected:
Then the user will receive one of the following message:

Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide and the user will be returned to where the video was launched from (WWE 'Home' view or 'Schedule > Today' depending on where the content was accessed from).

title: Scenario: User tries to access blacked out content that is running back to back with another blacked content of the same rule (or different B.O. rule)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to launch the EPG content
AND the content is blacked out so they are prevented from viewing the content
AND they receive the appropriate blackout message
AND they wait until the current program ends and then attempts to watch the next program
AND the content is blacked out
custom_expected:
THEN they will continue to be prevented from viewing the content 
AND will receive the appropriate Blackout message.

AND the Show Details page will be displayed.

AND successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account

*Sean Goldsmith can flip IP in and out of this state
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to access live linear content that is blacked out
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive a Generic Content Unavailable message:

"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout.”

title: Scenario: User with an undetermined location attempts to access non blacked out content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user's IP has been put into an undetermined state*
AND has launched the app
AND successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account

*Sean Goldsmith can flip IP in and out of this state
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to access live linear content that is NOT blacked out
custom_expected: THEN the content will launch without issue

title: Scenario: User attempts to watch no-longer-UK-blacked-out content while in UK
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is located in the UK
AND has launched the app
AND successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user tries to launch a VOD which is blacked out for UK location
AND sees the expected blackout message
AND QA environment asset blackout is removed
AND user attempts to launch same content
custom_expected:
THEN there will not be any blackout error messages
AND the VOD will play successfully.

Test ALL entry points:
- Network Home Screen
- Full Schedule
- Show page
